Riley Horn


Hello! I'm a research scientist with a background in biomechanics and motor control. As a biomechanist, I enjoy expanding my research toolbox through learning new data collection techniques and research software. I am currently interested in exploring research in wearable devices, biological signals, and biomechanical imaging. In my free time, I enjoy music, disc golf, and running.

Projects

I am currently seeking a research position in the field of biomechanics and motor control in the bay area. I have two years of experience as a clinical graduate researcher and hope to contribute to meaningful research in the field of health science. I studied Biomechanics & Motor Control at East Carolina University for graduate school and studied Movement Science at the University of Michigan in my undergraduate program. You can read about my master’s thesis here. Or you can check out my research posters about tactile somatosensation or 3D anthropometry. Also check out the slides below.
